review_title: Decent Entry Level Position, Be Prepared to Work
job_title: Case Manager in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: Pros include flexibility with your work schedule, opportunities for incentive bonuses, and potential for promotions if you already have a master's degree. This job will be a fine fit if you like people and have good organizational skills. If you have a positive attitude and are proactive regarding paperwork, the job can be smooth. The administration staff are passionate about what the center provides and the agency is always growing. Luckily, my direct supervisor was patient and kind. Most of the people I worked with were warm and cordial.
cons: The same passion and positive work culture does not always trickle down to case management. Cons include having to use your personal vehicle to transport clients, but the agency does provide mileage reimbursement checks each  month. Clients can be challenging to work with, but having that empathy component really helps to curb personal frustrations. Sometimes clients are in crisis and this may cause case managers to have to work later hours that day until it is all worked out. Work-place culture is unpredictable, but for case managers it isn't always positive. Case Managers often feel underappreciated and underpaid.

job_title: Family Assistance Worker in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: Creativity, innovation, and leadership is encouraged. Gain experience in a wide variety of subjects and roles. Team centered mindset. Genuine people. Valuable meaning found in line of work.
cons: Chaotic at times, not a good environment for people that crave structure or do not have flexibility. Difficult at times to accomplish all the tasks required of you during your normal work week.

job_title: Program Manager in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: I have worked here for almost 10 years, there is a lot of room for growth.  This agency truly cares about the consumers we take care of, and they care about their staff, which is evidenced by the benefits they have added.   We receive a good amount of time off.   If you are doing your job they don't micro manage you.  You are able to bring up any concerns to the administration.
cons: In almost ten years I haven't really come up with a real con.   Yes there are things that may be frustrating for a short time, but that is any job.

job_title: Credentialing Specialist in Cape Girardeau, MO
pros: Compared to other companies, the benefits  are best around.  The working hours and working conditions are above grade.  They offer affordable shirts to wear with our logo both short sleeves and long sleeves.  They encourage excercise and walking.  We get to wear jeans every day.  This is a great place to work.
cons: Sometimes working with hard clients are not the best.  Working with Mental Health clients take a special kind of person.  We have parking problems.  We have too many employees per building.

review_title: Great Company that Allows Personal Growth
job_title: Co-occurring Specialist in Fredericktown, MO
pros: A great atmosphere to work in!  There is more of a team approach here and everyone looks out for each other.  Many options available for growth.    Management is willing to listen to suggestions and to help continue making improvements as needed in the communities we serve.  I am allowed, and encouraged, to utilize my creativity  in groups, and to encourage growth in myself and Clients.
cons: Pay is not at the average, benefits are expensive and very limited.

review_title: Overall my experience with Community Counseling Center has been good.
